@description.body:

@description.name: @description
@description.body: A cell renderer factory which can dynamically exchange the cell renderer based on information retrieved at runtime. This is useful when different rows in a column should have different cell renderer based on cell content or row metadata. A typical example would be a spreadsheet that has different kind of data in one column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cellRendererFactoryFunction {Function?null} The initial value for
    the property {@link #cellRendererFactoryFunction}.
@param.description:
The initial value for
    the property {@link #cellRendererFactoryFunction}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Function that returns a cellRenderer instance which will be used for the row that is currently being edited. The function is defined like this: 

 myTable.getTableColumnModel().setCellRenderer(function(cellInfo){


   if (cellInfo.row == 5)
     return new qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Boolean;
   else
     return new qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Default;
 });

the function MUST return at least a qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Default

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Overridden; called whenever the cell updates. The cell will call the function stored in the cellRendererFactoryFunction to retrieve the cell renderer which should be used for this particular cell

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cellInfo {Map} A map containing the information about the cell to
     create.
@param.description:
A map containing the information about the cell to
     create.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
htmlArr {String[]} Target string container. The HTML of the data
     cell should be appended to this array.
@param.description:
Target string container. The HTML of the data
     cell should be appended to this array.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property cellRendererFactoryFunction. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #cellRendererFactoryFunction}.
